Class RS.XPATH

    • org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.RS.XPATH
  • Enclosing class:
    RS

    public static class RS.XPATH
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods returning an xpath.

      static boolean isRootHtml(org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext sc) 
      protected static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String text)
      Add single quote around the text (such as 'text'), and it will be used in XPATH for searching a web element in DOM.
      If the text (such as Tom's) contains single quote, we cannot simply quote the text with single quote, which will cause the error;
      instead we will use the function concat() to connect each part of the text, such as concat('Tom', "'", 's').
      static java.lang.String RELATIVE_MATCHING_TAG_START(java.lang.String tag)

      • RELATIVE_MATCHING_TAG_START

      • fromText

        public static java.lang.String fromText(java.lang.String text,
                        boolean partial,
                        boolean relative)
        Create an xpath by text for searching webelement within direct and indirect children.
        Parameters:
        text - String, the text of a webelement. can be regex if XPATH2.0
        partial - boolean, if the parameter text is part of the webelement's content
        relative - boolean, if true then searching elements under current WebElement; false then searching elements under ENTIRE document.
        Returns:
        String, the xpath for webdriver to search a webelement.

      • fromAttribute

        public static java.lang.String fromAttribute(java.lang.String attribute,
                             java.lang.String value,
                             boolean partial,
                             boolean relative)
        Create an xpath by (attribute, value) for searching webelement within direct and indirect children.
        Parameters:
        attribute - String, the attribute name
        value - String, the attribute's value, can be regex if XPATH2.0.
        partial - boolean, if the parameter value is part of the webelement's attribute
        relative - boolean, if true then searching elements under current WebElement; false then searching elements under ENTIRE document.
        Returns:
        String, the xpath for webdriver to search a webelement.

      • condition

        public static java.lang.String condition(java.lang.String attribute,
                         java.lang.String value,
                         boolean partialMatch)
        Parameters:
        attribute - String, the attribute name
        value - String, the expected value of the attribute
        partialMatch - boolean, if the attribute value will be matched partially (considered as a substring)
        Returns:
        String, the xpath condition for searching
        See Also:
        #getCondition(String, boolean)

      • conditionContains

        public static java.lang.String conditionContains(java.lang.String attribute,
                                 java.lang.String value)
        Parameters:
        attribute - String, the attribute name ending with "contains"
        value - String, the expected substring value of the attribute
        Returns:
        String, the xpath condition for searching
        See Also:
        #getCondition(String, boolean)

      • conditionForText

        public static java.lang.String conditionForText(java.lang.String text,
                                boolean partialMatch)
        Parameters:
        text - String, the text value
        partialMatch - boolean, if the text's value will be matched partially (considered as a substring)
        Returns:
        String, the xpath condition for searching

      • quote

        protected static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String text)
        Add single quote around the text (such as 'text'), and it will be used in XPATH for searching a web element in DOM.
        If the text (such as Tom's) contains single quote, we cannot simply quote the text with single quote, which will cause the error;
        instead we will use the function concat() to connect each part of the text, such as concat('Tom', "'", 's').
        Parameters:
        text - String, the text of the web element.
        Returns:
        String, the quoted text; or a string combined by function concat().

      • isRootHtml

        public static boolean isRootHtml(org.openqa.selenium.SearchContext sc)
